trans-unit.source: Document operations
trans-unit.target: Document operations

trans-unit.source: Document operations (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Document operations (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: In Azure Search, an index is populated using JSON documents that you upload to the service.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Search, an index is populated using JSON documents that you upload to the service.

trans-unit.source: All the documents that you upload comprise the corpus of your search data.
trans-unit.target: All the documents that you upload comprise the corpus of your search data.

trans-unit.source: Documents contain fields, some of which are tokenized into search terms as they are uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Documents contain fields, some of which are tokenized into search terms as they are uploaded.

trans-unit.source: The `/docs` URL segment in the Azure Search API represents the collection of documents in an index.
trans-unit.target: The `/docs` URL segment in the Azure Search API represents the collection of documents in an index.

trans-unit.source: All operations performed on the collection such as uploading, merging, deleting, or querying documents take place in the context of a single index, so the URLs for these operations will always start with `/indexes/[index name]/docs` for a given index name.
trans-unit.target: All operations performed on the collection such as uploading, merging, deleting, or querying documents take place in the context of a single index, so the URLs for these operations will always start with `/indexes/[index name]/docs` for a given index name.

trans-unit.source: Your application code can generate JSON documents to upload to Azure Search using a result set from a relational database, or any other structured data source.
trans-unit.target: Your application code can generate JSON documents to upload to Azure Search using a result set from a relational database, or any other structured data source.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Search Adventure Works Demo sample application on CodePlex includes code that builds JSON documents using a result set from the Adventure Works sample database.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Search Adventure Works Demo sample application on CodePlex includes code that builds JSON documents using a result set from the Adventure Works sample database.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about the sample application, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Search Adventure Works Demo (codeplex)</linkText><linkUri>https://azuresearchadventureworksdemo.codeplex.com/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about the sample application, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Search Adventure Works Demo (codeplex)</linkText><linkUri>https://azuresearchadventureworksdemo.codeplex.com/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: In the majority of application development scenarios, search data is separate and external to your application data layer.
trans-unit.target: In the majority of application development scenarios, search data is separate and external to your application data layer.

trans-unit.source: If your application uses an on-premises database for tracking inventory status, the documents persisted in Azure Search will contain similar or identical data values in terms of product name, price, and availability, but they will be stored in an inverted index in order to optimize searches.
trans-unit.target: If your application uses an on-premises database for tracking inventory status, the documents persisted in Azure Search will contain similar or identical data values in terms of product name, price, and availability, but they will be stored in an inverted index in order to optimize searches.

trans-unit.source: You should plan on having one document for each item that you want to search.
trans-unit.target: You should plan on having one document for each item that you want to search.

trans-unit.source: A movie rental application might have one document per movie, a storefront application might have one document per SKU, an online courseware application might have one document per course, a research firm might have one document for each academic paper in their repository, and so on
trans-unit.target: A movie rental application might have one document per movie, a storefront application might have one document per SKU, an online courseware application might have one document per course, a research firm might have one document for each academic paper in their repository, and so on

trans-unit.source: Documents consist of one or more fields.
trans-unit.target: Documents consist of one or more fields.

trans-unit.source: Fields can contain text that is tokenized into search terms, as well as non-tokenized or non-text values that can be used in filters or scoring profiles.
trans-unit.target: Fields can contain text that is tokenized into search terms, as well as non-tokenized or non-text values that can be used in filters or scoring profiles.

trans-unit.source: The names, data types, and search features supported for each field are determined by the index schema.
trans-unit.target: The names, data types, and search features supported for each field are determined by the index schema.

trans-unit.source: One of the fields in each index schema must be designated as an ID, and each document must have a value for the ID field that uniquely identifies that document in the index.
trans-unit.target: One of the fields in each index schema must be designated as an ID, and each document must have a value for the ID field that uniquely identifies that document in the index.

trans-unit.source: All other document fields are optional and will default to a null value if left unspecified.
trans-unit.target: All other document fields are optional and will default to a null value if left unspecified.

trans-unit.source: Note that null values do not take up space in the inverted index.
trans-unit.target: Note that null values do not take up space in the inverted index.

trans-unit.source: Before you can upload documents, you must have already created the index on the service.
trans-unit.target: Before you can upload documents, you must have already created the index on the service.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="ecafed05-c746-4d9e-ac8e-653066e909b5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Index (Azure Search API)</link> for details about this first step.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="ecafed05-c746-4d9e-ac8e-653066e909b5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Index (Azure Search API)</link> for details about this first step.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Search Public Preview supports English only for full-text search.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Search Public Preview supports English only for full-text search.

trans-unit.source: Operations on Documents
trans-unit.target: Operations on Documents

trans-unit.source: Allowable operations on Azure Search documents include the following:
trans-unit.target: Allowable operations on Azure Search documents include the following:

trans-unit.source: Once you have created an index, you can start adding, updating or removing documents that match the configured schema into the index.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created an index, you can start adding, updating or removing documents that match the configured schema into the index.

trans-unit.source: This step populates the index that you previously defined on the service.
trans-unit.target: This step populates the index that you previously defined on the service.

trans-unit.source: You can use either OData query syntax or a simple syntax to formulate search queries in your application code.
trans-unit.target: You can use either OData query syntax or a simple syntax to formulate search queries in your application code.

trans-unit.source: Suggestions are type-ahead, auto-complete queries that are displayed as the user enters a search term.
trans-unit.target: Suggestions are type-ahead, auto-complete queries that are displayed as the user enters a search term.

trans-unit.source: For example, while typing "mountain bikes", a list of potential queries that include "mountain bikes" drop down below the search box.
trans-unit.target: For example, while typing "mountain bikes", a list of potential queries that include "mountain bikes" drop down below the search box.

trans-unit.source: Suggestions are a document operation because potential queries are built from the fields in your documents.
trans-unit.target: Suggestions are a document operation because potential queries are built from the fields in your documents.

trans-unit.source: You can retrieve a document by its ID, which can be useful when you know exactly which document should be returned in the search results list.
trans-unit.target: You can retrieve a document by its ID, which can be useful when you know exactly which document should be returned in the search results list.

trans-unit.source: Azure Search .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Azure Search .NET SDK
